intro: Lasiosiphon esterhuyseniae, commonly known as the Esterhuysenia morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces vibrant blue or purple flowers that bloom in the morning. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is also valued in traditional medicine.
